1:
Praise Yahweh!\q1 It is good to sing praises to our God.
\q2 It is a delightful thing to do and the right thing to do.



\q1
2:
Jerusalem was destroyed, but Yahweh is enabling us to build Jerusalem again.\q2 He is bringing back the people who were taken to other lands.
\q1
3:
He enables those who were very discouraged to be encouraged again;\q2 it is as though they have wounds and he bandages them.



\q1
4:
He has determined how many stars there will be\q2 and gives names to all of them.
\q1
5:
Yahweh is great and very powerful,\q2 and no one can measure how much he understands.


\q1
6:
Yahweh lifts up those who have been oppressed,\q2 and he throws the wicked down to the ground.
\q1
7:
Thank Yahweh while you are singing to him to praise him;\q2 on the harps, play music to our God.


\q1
8:
He covers the sky with clouds,\q2 and then he sends rain to the earth
\q2 and causes grass to grow on the hills.
\q1
9:
He gives to animals the food that they need;\q2 he gives food to young crows when they cry out because they are hungry.



\q1
10:
He is not impressed with strong horses\q2 or with men who can run fast.
\q1
11:
Instead, what pleases him are those who have an awesome respect for him,\q2 those who confidently expect him to continue to love them as he promised to do.



\q1
12:
You people of Jerusalem, praise Yahweh!\q2 Praise your God!
\q1
13:
He guards your city by keeping its gates strong.\q1 He blesses the people who live there.
\q1
14:
He causes your people to become wealthy.\q2 He gives you plenty of very good wheat to eat.



\q1
15:
He commands things to happen throughout the earth;\q2 his words quickly reach the place to which he sends them.
\q1
16:
He sends snow to cover the ground like a white wool blanket,\q2 and he scatters frost on the ground as wind scatters ashes.


\q1
17:
He sends hail down like pebbles;\q2 when that happens, it is very difficult to endure because the air becomes very cold.
\q1
18:
But he commands the wind to blow, and it blows.\q2 Then the hail melts and the water flows into the streams.



\q1
19:
He sends his message to the descendants of Jacob;\q2 he tells to his Israelite people the things that he has decreed and what he has decided.
\q1
20:
He has not done that for any other nation;\q2 the other nations do not know his laws.
\q1 Praise Yahweh!
